contentrichtext.text: ==Telephone== '''[[Telephone]]s - main lines in use:''' 24,000 (2005)<ref name=cia2009>[https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/ng.html#Comm CIA Factbook:Niger, Communications]. updated 10 February 2009, retrieved 18 February 2009.</ref> '''Telephones - mobile cellular:''' 900,000 (2007) '''Telephone system:''' small system of wire, radiotelephone communications, and microwave radio relay links concentrated in southwestern area <br>''domestic:'' combined fixed-line and mobile-cellular teledensity only about 7 per 100 persons; The United Nations estimates placed telephone subscribers at .2 per hundred in 2000, rising to 2.5 per hundred in 2006.<ref name=unpocket2007>[http://data.un.org/CountryProfile.aspx?crname=Niger Profile]. World Statistics Pocketbook, United Nations Statistics Division, (2007).</ref> domestic satellite system with 3 earth stations and 1 planned <br>''international:'' country code - 227; [[satellite]] earth stations - 2 [[Intelsat]] (1 [[Atlantic Ocean]] and 1 [[Indian Ocean]])<ref name=cia2009 /> ==Radio== '''[[Radio]] [[Broadcasting|broadcast]] stations:''' AM 5, FM 6, shortwave 4 (2001) <ref name=cia2009 /> '''Radios:''' 680,000 (1997),<ref name=cia2009 /> 500,000 (1992)<ref name="Decalo1997">{{Cite book |last=Decalo |first=Samuel |title=Historical Dictionary of the Niger (3rd ed.) |publisher=Scarecrow Press|location=Boston & Folkestone |year=1997 |isbn=0-8108-3136-8 }}{{rp|231}}</ref> ==Television== '''[[Television]] broadcast stations:''' 5 (2007) '''Televisions:''' 125,000 (1997),<ref name=cia2009 /> 37,000 (1992)<ref name="Decalo1997" /> ==Internet== There are an estimated 40,000 internet users in Niger (2006), and 216 (1999) Internet service hosts: ISPs and other direct connections to the internet. The Top level domain is [[.ne]], and its assignment is controlled by the parastatal telecom company, [[SONITEL]].<ref name=cia2009 /> The UN estimated in 2006 that there were only .3 internet users per 100 Nigeriens, but this had risen from less than .1 per 100 in 2000.<ref name=unpocket2007 /> As a point of reference, the [[Millennium Development Goal]] for least developed countries by 2015 is 8.16 Internet users per 100 population.<ref>[http://mdgs.un.org/unsd/mdg/SeriesDetail.aspx?srid=605&crid=562 United Nations MDC statistical website], retrieved 2009-02-18</ref> ==See also== *[[Economy of Niger]] *[[Media of Niger]] *[[SONITEL]]: state owned telecommunications company. *[[Office of Radio and Television of Niger]]: State broadcast authority. ==References== {{Reflist}} *[https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/ng.html#Comm CIA Factbook:Niger, Communications]. updated 10 February 2009, retrieved 18 February 2009. *[http://www.stat-niger.org/Annuaire/transp.htm Transports et télécoms (Statistical series)].
